intro: Soehrensia formosa subsp. formosa, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, rich soils along stream banks and in wetlands. The plant features showy, yellowish-orange inflorescences that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
